Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful Staff, Shady Location and Away from Attractions”
Reviews.Author: LMV2012
Reviews.Content: To start, there are a lot of little things/irritations that I am going to let go and not even bother really commenting on or this would turn into a blog. We stayed here for the weekend of April 20th-22nd 2012 to go see Amsterdam and Keukenhof Tulip Gardens. We chose this hotel due to the reviews...unsure why they are rated so fabulous. The entrance was a little difficult to find, and walking around the area to get to it looked as if we might be staying in a third world country. The cost of the room for TWO NIGHTS was almost 350 euro....looking at this price...we thought this was going to be a pretty nice area and hotel. We were wrong. The area this hotel is located in is very shady and ghetto....not the type of neighborhood I would like to walk around in at night. There is nowhere to eat breakfast in the area (this being why the hotel charges you 15 euro per person for breakfast) except for a small Middle Eastern bakery filled with mystery meat and fish pastries. The hotel staff is not very helpful at all. They do not explain anything and upon arrival they grab a map off of the counter and circle the hotel and draw a line (this whole thing happens in about 3.4 seconds). No one explains anything and their info on where/which buses is not accurate or understandable. There are minor things like the dust and dirt on the glass area above the coffee cups, but that did not really bother me too much. Needless to say, when we do this again we will be staying in Leidesplein...it is a more open area, lots to do, many food choices and seems to be a lot safer. On a positive note, the bus runs very close to the hotel and it is only like a 150 to 200 meter walk and we were able to buy a bus/metro travel card at a good price from the hotel. Also, I guess it is positive that nothing happened to either of us on our trip. Bottom line, if you want somewhere with food choices and closer to the city with attractions....this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel just not in city centre”
Reviews.Author: Cheryll M
Reviews.Content: Clean large well furnished rooms. It was a pleasant hotel and even though it was a distant from the city centre it was quiet. We had the tour bus to take us to the city so it wasn't a drama being away from the city centre. I noticed public transport was nearly at the door anyway. I would stay there again and use the public transport system.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good value, good staff and fine location.”
Reviews.Author: Rcaocat
Reviews.Content: This hotel has understood what matters to travellers like us. No over the top reception area but all you want, clean and tidy with helpful staff and good rooms. Our first quad room 251 (beware all quad rooms are by the lift - people noise occasionally a problem rather than the lifts) was rather narrow so accessing the free in room safe was quite a challenge! The beds were comfortable, the shower room clean and tidy, and tv had BBC1 and BBC2 although many channels were in English anyway. Also there was a kettle with tbags and coffee - beware - no milk! Unfortunately we were cold. Our heating / AC didn't seem to work so on the second evening we went down to reception who couldn't do anything but gave us extra covers. The following morning they kindly moved us to room 250 which was excellent. It was way more spacious with a bathroom instead of shower and slightly different layout which just worked much better. Far superior to our first room. When we checked out, our bags were stored and then when we returned in the afternoon before getting our bus to the airport, staff were more than happy to make us each a cup of tea for free which was just what we needed. There are 2 computers in the reception area so you can do your online check in for flights there. Wireless in the hotel was free and worked well in bedrooms too. Breakfast was all excellent, there were even sausages (see someone else's previous gripe!), but we tended to have the pastries, cheeses and meats and special breads. Coffee was really very good for a hotel. As hardened expresso drinkers we thought it was about the best we have had, far better than the usual insipid filter coffee. And you could have several cups with no problem. However, the fruit juice needs sorting out - orange juice was just completely flavourless. All in all, if you aren't bothered about the hotel being beautiful from the outside (it isn't) it really is very good giving you all you need for a comfortable city break.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel away from the center”
Reviews.Author: _G_o_g_a_goga
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit away from the center but the Metro and tram are close. Rooms are spacious but cold- AC did not work. Bathrooms are big and clean. Clean towels every day.Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, not in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Kierand80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a tour so can't really comment on the value, however this was one of the nicer hotels we stayed at. Apart from not being in the centre of Amsterdam is a good choice, the rooms were large, well decorated and the bed was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: gauravm03
Reviews.Content: Stayed once here, it is reasonably good value for money as Amsterdam hotels are overpriced. Tram stop is 5 mins walk but the Metro can be reached only by tram. The room was quite good sized, the decor and style is a bit old but everything was neat and clean. Would stay here again if I find it again as the good price I did the first time

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel but too far from centre”
Reviews.Author: Norherner
Reviews.Content: We had a short break package in Amsterdam with DFDS. Booking presented many diffculties, but we finished up at the Best Western Blue Square. The hotel was said to be cheaper because it was outside the centre. It was supposed to be a short tram or bus ride from the centre. The first problem was finding the hotel. We were taken to the Best Western Blue Tower which is about 4 tram stops away. When we arrived a visitor was being directed to the Blue Tower. Apparently it happens all the time! What on earth is the Best Western group doing with two similarly named hotels so close together in Amsterdam. An ergonomic disaster waiting to happen! The hotel is well served by bus (to Central Station) and tram (Dam Square and museum district). Each trip costs almost 3 Euros and takes 30 mins. If you want to do a tour with coach pickup then you have to be ready at least one hour before departure, again a long way out so first pick-up. Get a day card for about 7 Euros and give it lots of use on the excellent public transport system. The hotel is actually set in a fairly quiet principally Turkish area, lots of restaurants but nothing obviously tempting. Food at the hotel was acceptable both for dinner and breakfast. The choice for a la carte at dinner was a bit limited. Coffee seemed particularly good (quality and value) whether in the Restaurant or the Foyer Bar. Probably because of the prices the hotel seemed to be popular with school parties. Not really a problem but the restaurant was overwhelmed at times during breakfast. The condition of the hotel was excellent and it was well-appointed. Things seemed to work fine and it was clean The only faults I found were low flow in bath, (use the shower to fill), and broken indicator lights around the lift. The bedrooms were well-equipped, the showers particularly good. The outstanding feature was the friendliness, helpfulness and knowledge of the staff. Go for a room at the rear and ask for a bath (most have this after a tiring day in the city) On balance its a pity about the distance out, because this hotel has many good facets. If you think you can tolerate the travel, try it.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: mainswiring
Reviews.Content: I'd read various reviews on TA on the Blue Square hotel & the general consensus was quite positive. I chose the hotel mainly on price - the fact that the hotel was not right in the centre of Amsterdam was not of any concern. The price included parking and breakfast. The hotel was clean and tidy (and very popular - a number of large school/college groups were also staying there). Our room was quite large with a view to the rear of the hotel overlooking a wide canal inlet. Staff were helpful in assisting us with public transport from the hotel into the city centre (approx 20 minutes by tram or bus - very easy to use - we bought a 3-day pass from the Central Railway Station). The breakfast was a buffet including cereals, breads, fruit, bacon & eggs. The Slotermeer area was also quite nice with various restaurants, shops and an open-air market. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but rubbish location.”
Reviews.Author: Idletraveller86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in June. Having arrived at the airport and then got the connecting train to the city centre, we eventually found the right tram to get us too the hotel. We were surprised by how far the hotel was from the city centre which was a problem in itself due to having to pay for a bus or tram each time we wanted to go to the centre (at cost) but probably our own fault for not looking into this more beforehand! Still worth noting though. Upon arrival at the tram stop, we soon felt like we were in the wrong part of town and probably the place locals would avoid was the impression we got.Bit like some parts of the Uk. Run down and dated buildings and lots of shops with arabic signed food shops which means travelling back to the centre if you want food. The hotel itself, from the outside, is like a soviet union communist style tower block. The room itself and general hotel decor was like a throw back to the 80s, at least decor style but was at least clean enough which for me is the top priority. The bed was good enough, the tv worked and all the lights worked. The main problem we had was noise night and day. Not from outside but from (we think) the air conditioning unit in the room which was very loud and had no obvious way of turning it off. Not great if you had planned on sleeping. We also got woken up very early one mornign when the fire alarm went off followed (10 minutes later) by a false alarm announcement. Overall a dated hotel, crap location with zero in the way of local amenities i.e. food shops, & expensive for what it is. Pay more and find a nicer hotel closer to the centre but will add that Amsterdam itself was a huge let down. Great if you go there for the 'coffee shops' but we stayed a week and struggled after 2 days to keep occupied. Happy travelling people!

Reviews.Title: “3 day break”
Reviews.Author: Hav1onme
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with excellent staff and good spacious room, get the breakfast it is worth it. The hotel staff were miles better for info than the girl with attitude at tourist information. Around 20 min tram ride (buy the 3 day pass as it also takes you from the hotel to the airport direct) from the center which is no bother. Watch out for bikes they are dangerous as you cannot hear them coming. Try the Indrapura indonesian restaurant at Rembrandtplein - it is excellent but not cheap. Drinks are not cheap as is the food so pick carefully. Go later in March as the tulip displays/ gardens are not open any earlier. Generally the Dutch speak good English and are very friendly. There is a big mix of different cultures which seem to get on very well. They would put us to shame. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “EXELLENT VALUE !!”
Reviews.Author: daznmel
Reviews.Content: we were not to sure about this hotel as we booked it online. WOW is al i can say........ beds.......... comfy and clean breakfast........ full continental & delicious staff.......... really freindly & helpful this hotel is 20 mins on the tram from amsterdam centre, we bought a 72 hr pass for the tram ( 16 eruo) this was perfect for us, there were trams every 10 mins right to gone 12 at night. then there was a night bus running all night, you can catch a 14 or 7 tram or 21 bus ( which was just as quick as the tram) we caught a 69 bus from the airport and it took us straight to hotel, if your on a buget this is the hotel for you as there is a massive shopping centre next to the hotel. would defo go back to this hotel and i would recomend it to anyone........ 100% satisfied :o)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: houndtang
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a pleasant stay at the Blue Square over a weekend break. The hotel doesn't look much from outside but the rooms though small are well furnished, clean and comfortable with canal views from some of them. Breakfast was good and the reception helpful. The free wi-fi service was also much appreciated and worked well. Although a little way out of the centre, the Blue Square is well-served by public transport with the 69 bus going from Schiphol AIrport almost to the door and back. Also the 14 tram which takes you into the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: louu01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my fiance - excellent hotel doesn't look much from the outside but is very well kept and has beautiful rooms inside the hotel. Very helpful staff. Good breakfast. The only thing I would say is that it's a bit far from the city centre - we had to get a tram and a bus to get there but other than that everything was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jebir
Reviews.Content: Nice and well-maintained hotel. Very helpful staff, and nice rooms - more than we expected. A bit far from the center of Amsterdam, but then again, the tram-system is very good, and easy to use. Good and plenty breakfast! Will consider this hotel if going back to Amsterdam at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning problem”
Reviews.Author: dnbosiris
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful and our room was clean and spacious. However the thermostat in our room did not work which we did not discover until late on the first night. The staff were good at quickly finding us another room however when we moved into the room we found that it had had a very strong smell of smoke. So back to the reception again and we were told that there were no other rooms that we could take at the back of the hotel which is where we wanted to stay as it has a view of the canal. So we went back to our original room and were given a small portable heater to keep us warm. Location wise it's about 20 minutes out of central amsterdam and there are 2 trams or a bus you can take which take you to different locations in Amsterdam. A word of warning, we missed our shuttle bus back to the airport on our last night and we had to get a taxi organised by the hotel which cost 40 euros - so not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good, standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: jl747-13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while I was on tour in January 2012 for two nights. It was a typical Best Western, comfortable but nothing special about it. It was a little ways from the centre of Amsterdam, but public transport stopped less then five minutes away from the hotel. The rooms were clean, and modern, and there was a decent breakfast served in the morning. All and all it was a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: nassar z
Reviews.Content: brilliant hotel tram /bus stop outside hotel its so cheap to get around amsterdam 15mins outside amsterdam city but do not let this put you off the transport is so good its every 3-5 mins its that easy get a 3 day pass 13 euros each and you get anywhere in amsterdam get this at the airport its easy so you can use it to get to your hotel ,, do not get a taxi they were going to charge me 40-45 euros ridicules previos holidays i would have paid but the bus ride was brilliant you get to your hotel just the same time as the taxi i have just got back on the 2nd march 2012 the weather was ok cold but no rain though its a nice place but very expensive though like any city i suppose out and drinks too make sure you look at the menus.. but regaridng the transport its the best to get a round ,, every where you are there is a stop to take you home or take you somewgere else .. the hotel was very helpfull helped you to get to the destinations the buffet breahkfast was awsome from hot food to cold food ,, the fruit drinks were so great they were 100 squezed fruit juice .. i would go again to this hotel again .,

Reviews.Title: “A lovely birthday treat !”
Reviews.Author: JDT1415
Reviews.Content: As a family stayed here for 3 nights. We had 2 rooms, a double and a twin. The twin room was the nicer of the two. It had double aspect windows, our room was a double next door, it seemed quite small by comparison. Both looked out over the canal. Everyone was very helpful in the hotel, we asked for directions, bus times and tram times, where to catch the transport and the best places to get off, all our questions were answered with knowledge. The hotel is a little ride away from the city centre, but enjoy the ride and see the outskirts of the city. It takes about 25 minutes to go one way. Buy a pass from the local shop for the journeys. There are shops around and a market. Lots of eating areas around. It all seemed to be safe. Watch out for the bike riders, they take offence to you walking in the bike lanes.. we got told off a few times.. The city of Amsterdam is very busy, there are lots to see and do, we went to The Anne Frank House, canal cruise, Hard Rock Cafe Bar, Ice Bar, topped off with a walk around the Red Light District.. It was all a lot of fun. We spent our evenings just sitting in the Hotel bar area having a drink, a lot of guests seemed to do this. We had an evening meal in the Hotel we did not like it so always ate out.... They have free internet in the reception so this kept my 14 yr old and me very happy.!! I travelled with my Husband, 14 yr old and my mom 82.. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: MandMDurham
Reviews.Content: One of Amsterdam's hidden gems - as others have mentioned, transport to/from the hotel is easy & cheap, & the hotel itself is very comfortable. We will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MOCHYNDU
Reviews.Content: Yes as others have mentioned this hotel is a twenty minute tram ride out of the city but dont let that put you off. Transport is easy and cheap, the area is quiet and safe, the hotel is good value and has excellent customer service. Breakfast is fine although we did have a bit of rush on waiting for them to open it at 7am as we had to get to airport by 8. There is a bus that links the airport to this hotel but you can also go viva central station. The staff were polite, speak perfect english. I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: TravelmodeEngaged
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days in Amsterdam and enjoyed every second of it. The Blue Square Hotel is a great place to stay, the staff were very helpful. Initially they gave me an information pack of what the city has to offer, guides and a map. Spent time going through all of it with me, even though there were a few people behind me waiting to check in. The room was excellent, good quality, tasteful furnishings and you could tell the walls were soundproofed as the room is silent. The bed was so comfortable, I had to set my alarm in the mornings otherwise I would have just kept on sleeping. The room itself was comfortable temperature wise, it was -12 outside on a couple of the nights but you couldn't tell inside the hotel. It was a fair distance out of the city, but the tram and metro systems are easy to figure out and fairly regular. So, it's not too bad. Breakfast was average, but it was only 10 Euro. I just wish there was a bit more of a selection. It should also be mentioned that the Wi-fi is excellent, easily the best Wi-Fi that I have had at a hotel and it was free. After my awful time in Paris, it was good to get to a hotel that actually wants repeat customers and that's what the Blue Square will get. When I come back to Amsterdam, I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a brilliant weekend”
Reviews.Author: janlangton
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for the first time. Had a brilliant welcome from reception staff, very polite and very knowledgeable. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The outside of the hotel was a bit grubby but inside was lovely. The room was light and airy and heated up very quickly. Breakfast was very varied and catered for everyone. This hotel is outside of the city so trams/buses from just around the corner from the hotel. We also purchased a 72 hour ticket which worked out a lot cheaper. Shops near by and a super restaurant opposite - Toetanchamon and again everyone very friendly. Wuld certainly recommend this hotel if you want somewhere quiet to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, clean room, nice breakfast and good access to tram link”
Reviews.Author: NewlyWed14
Reviews.Content: Great value for money as it is located outside of the centre. A tram runs just outside and takes around 20 minutes to Dam Square and the centre of Amsterdam. Nice quiet location. Doesn't look like much from the outside but the inside is very clean and the rooms are comfortable. We were on the ground floor facing the front of the hotel so we could hear the trams outside but this wasn't a problem as it isn't very loud. The breakfast was very good with lots of variety. Service was excellent. One of the plus points of this hotel was the free wifi. Very helpful staff at reception and tram tickets can be purchased here. We opted for a 48hour pass which was cheaper than buying daily tickets. Would recommend this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: christine c
Reviews.Content: Returned today from a 3 day stay at this hotel and definitely will be back. The hotel was spotless, the staff so helpful and friendly and no request was too much. Ok so it is a 20 minute tram ride from the city centre but it is in a nice quite location. You can take a number 69 bus from the airport for 2.60 euros ( beats paying 35 euros for a taxi and that is cheap) just ask off at Plein 40/45 and it will be more or less opposite the hotel. We took a taxi from the airport but the bus back.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit, Still a Great Choice for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sam_king86
Reviews.Content: 2nd Visit to this hotel, and still think it a great choice for a trip to Amsterdam. Around 20 mins from the city centre, its much quieter, better value for money, and very clean and damp free unlike many of the City Centre hotels at comparible prices. We were on the ground floor towards the back of the hotel, and there was some noise from the staff area where they must all walk past the door, but this was never before around 07:30 so didnt really disturb us. The room was nicely furnished, and the beds extremely comfortable. The only real let down at this hotel was the restaurant. Breakfast (additionally chargable, and not cheap!) is bland and greasy, but far better then the evening service, which while being an expensive option was far from tastey - yet again very greasy and limited poor choice - we were the only ones eating in the restaurant on that night, and now we know why! Reception staff are very helpful and really make the place welcoming. We will be back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: REDBIRDCHEF
Reviews.Content: Our family spent New Years weekend (6days total) at this hotel and highly recommend it. After reading many reviews of other Amsterdam hotels, the word "bedbugs" was abundant. This hotel was spotless, with housekeeping checking with you twice a day for anything you might need - linen,towels, soap etc..). We had two rooms, cheaper than 1 quad, and they were both lovely. The hotel is in a Turkish neighbourhood and I think this is an asset, There is a nice market in the nearby square, shops, indoor mall, restaurants and bakeries nearby. Also a Turkish supermarket on the square, you have to try the breads and olives. We like to shop and travel like "locals" so taking the tram and buses to the tourist spots was a pleasure. They run every 10 mins. or so and listening to all the varied conversations truly makes Amsterdam a multi-cultural city. We went for daily walks around the hotel and it was perfectly safe and de-stressing after being downtown all day. The front desk staff were very helpful, the sell transit passes and help with maps and directions, all in perfect english. Approx. 20 mins to/from Schiphol, eays to get to. We would definately stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “STRAIGHT FROM THE HORSES MOUTH”
Reviews.Author: KEOHANEANN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned (22 Dec11) from a six day visit to Amsterdam. We read the findings of previous guests and thought we would tell it as it was for us. We enjoyed our stay at the Blue Square and occupied an attractive corner room on the second floor to the rear of the Hotel, which looked like it had recently been refurbished. It was very clean and quiet. Although the windows were large, there was one at the side that opened. The room overlooked a canal. The air conditioning worked perfectly. Breakfast was extensive and generous. The friendly staff made us very welcome and were only too happy to be of help. For example in providing fried eggs to complete our English breakfast on request. Getting to and from the City is easy. The tickets (obtained from Reception) are valid on the tram, bus and Metro. For the tram, turn right when leaving the Hotel, donâ€™t cross over but walk to the end of the road passed the market and shops. The stop for No 14 tram will have â€œFlevoparkâ€� on the front and is just to the right of the junction. â€œDam Squareâ€� where its all happening is sixteen stops. Each stop is displayed inside the tram as you reach it. If you ask the conductor for a time table, all the stops are listed on the cover. Swipe your ticket when entering and leaving the tram. Returning to the Hotel, the 14 Tram stop is opposite the main entrance of the Magna Plaza shopping complex in Dam Square. The tram will have â€œSlotermeerâ€� on the front. Get off at â€˜Plein â€˜40-â€™45. When you get off the tram, cross the road and walk to the right for the Hotel. Watch out for traffic and bikes at all times when on foot! We survived Naples but had a couple of near misses with bikes without lights.

Reviews.Title: “The comforts of home away from home”
Reviews.Author: batmaing
Reviews.Content: Having come off my trip in Paris (see Hotel de la Tour Eiffel) Best Western blew me away! It was roomy with modern comforts (thermostat, hot pot for tea/coffee, solid free WiFi). It was cold and rainy and our rooms were comfortable enough to stay in most of the day to wait things out. The Not really much to say or criticize about Best Western Blue Square: the staff was great and it really was a pleasant stay. The only thing I can possibly "complain" about is that this hotel was a little out of the way. However, this really encouraged you to know the public transport system to get to where you want...which isn't really a bad thing at all, is it?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin G
Reviews.Content: The favourite hotel of our Contiki Tour Blue Square had a great breakfast and really nice rooms. The room was modern, with a nice bathroom and a safe and all very clean and tidy. There was even a view of a little canal in the hallway near our room. There is a supermarket and other shops nearby. The breakfast was very tasty - buffet style with really yummy bacon, eggs, pastries, yoghurt, fruit and cereals. We had a dinner there too which was quite nice. Location is not the best but you can jump on a tram into the city without having to change trams.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SwindonJo25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from the 3rd december to the 6th we had a triple and a double room and both were lovely and clean. Beds and pillows are comfy the staff are all very helpful and gave us any info we needed such as tram numbers to get you can also buy the tickets at the hotel it i about a twenty minute tram journey into the centre which is fine as we were aware of this and they stop just down the road from the hotel number 14. Breakfast was very good lots of choice, we also ate at the hotel two nights to save us going back into the centre all our meals were nice and so was the wine :0) would stay again and also free internet in the lobby and a free wifi code for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: Erin M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Staff were very friendly and the room was clean, big and the bed was very comfortable. It was a short (15min) tram ride into the city but it was quiet enough and had plenty of shops around for everything we needed. Food was good, a little expensive but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Western quality you expect”
Reviews.Author: struct84
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel. The staff are very rude and seem to intentionally be unhelpful in trying to locate anything. I was expecting at least Best Western courteous service, but these folks acted as though they were bothered by even checking a guest in. When I asked for some ice, it took about 20 minutes. The rooms are small, not very nice, and it's just not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: jackkkkk
Reviews.Content: The staff here at the Blue Square Hotel are fantastic! From the housekeepers to the Reception staff, they are all more than happy to assist you in any way possible! Rooms are very clean and comfortable! They are quite large, with plenty of space to spread out and relax. The bathroom was also huge, with a fantastic shower, and the fluffiest towels in Europe!!! We also had a great view onto one of Amsterdam's many canals! Breakfast and dinner was also quite enjoyable. As other reviews have stated, yes it is a little bit out of the city centre! But the prices also reflect that! Get yourself a tram pass, and you will be in the city centre in less that 10 minutes. The location isn't as terrible as people make it out to be. I didn't see any homeless people or violence what so ever. If your after a clean and modern hotel with great service, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “best western blue square hotel amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: effesdrinker
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Amsterdam (brilliant place for everyone) all the hotel staff were lovely ,a great variety for breakfast and the hotel is close to quite a few restaurants without having to go into the city itself.Tram ride into Dam square was 15 to 20 minutes and really easy. Will definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Peace and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Philip J
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at blue square hotel very clean, very helpful staff.Locality safe even at night local shops good local school children helpful with language problems. Went on 21 bus to central square on recommendation of reception who explained it perfectly followed by canal cruise wonderful day. Breakfast ample but a sausage and hash brown wouldnt go amiss. Had two evening meals (specials) chef catered for every requirement. Only minuses, room hot and a bit stuffy at times and no way of opening window but did see other windows open so maybe only our room.Shower/bath not really suitable for mobility problems like we had but when asked for extra non slip mats they were produced immediatly. All in all a very relaxing and quiet stay some may find not being close to bright lights a problem but as said before 21 bus has you there in 20 mins.We will deffinately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and calm”
Reviews.Author: shijipuyath1979
Reviews.Content: Hello All, This is my third visit to Amsterdam, i have been staying in hotels near to airport till date now i was looking for a change and i found out this hotel and i had a every great day stay of 2 days and starting from the reception it was a very pleasant experience with24 hours room service and all the staff was very cooperative and helpful even they arrange for maps of the places you want to visit. This hotels is just in between a Lake ( name not remembering) with lot of swams swimming around and i was enjoying the natural beauty by sitiing in my room For people who are on business tours and need some sound sleep with out any noise and disturbance this is a very gud hotel

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and management”
Reviews.Author: Gal T
Reviews.Content: We noticed that the makeup bottle broken. Probably the housekeeping broke it. We came to the front desk that said that the hotel manager not here and we can speak with him only by e-mail. The first mail ignored, the second was with stupid excuse that the hosekeeping in vacation so i need to wait until she will come back to work (Dont you hear about TELEPHONE??!!) After two weeks that no one respond I sent the third mail that also roughly ignored. Stay away from this hotel. your personals belongings not protected. Horrible management! NEVER NEVER come back to this hotel again. Very far from Amsterdam center and located in scary neighborhood with homeless people

Reviews.Title: “City Beak hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan L
Reviews.Content: Well run hotel with spacious rooms and bathrooms; comfortable bed. Good breakfast. Convenient for tam to city centre but its a 15 - 20 minute trip

Reviews.Title: “great hotel bad location!”
Reviews.Author: Lital T
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel for 7 night. the hotel is very nice and clean, the stuff is great very helpful with directions. we got a nice room with a view to the canal, the room was very clean and comfortable. the bad and the shower was amazing!!! the breakfast buffet is rich and fresh. the location is about 20 minutes tram ride from the center. the neighborhood is not so pleasant... generally the area is a non-dutch area (to say the least) we were afraid to come back late at night. overall i would say that we enjoyed our stay, yet we would rather pay more and stay in a safer area and a closer to center.

Reviews.Title: “I very much enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: PinkyB69
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel in a neighborhood not in the center of anything. The tram stop is right in front of the hotel. The staff at the front desk was very helpful. The room was a nice size and clean. The hotel restaurant was a bonus since after some evenings out I was not in the mood to go out and look for dinner. I am returning to Amsterdam shortly and trying my luck at another hotel closer to the museum district but I am sure if I am unhappy I will find my way back to the Blue Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: allysangel
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from Amsterdam and we spent 4 nights in the Blue Square. The hotel was lovely, we had a great, spacious, clean room. The staff were great and very helpful. We were prepared for the hotel to be a 20 minute tram ride, but it never bothered us. The tram stop was a very short walk from the hotel and the trams ran on time so there was no problem. The 72hr travel card was great value at only â‚¬15.50 and this covered the tram, buses and metro if you wanted it. We never got a taxi anywhere, the trams were more than sufficent. We didn't eat in the hotel but that was only because of my love for the pancake bakerys in the city so we'd wait until we got into the city to have breakfast in the mornings :-) All in all we enjoyed our stay here. We both agreed that we would love to come back to Amsterdam and when we do we will definately be staying in the Blue Square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but away from the centre.”
Reviews.Author: Makitta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice inside clean and nice atmosphere. It was 20 or so minutes from the centre of Amsterdam and 20-30 minutes away from the airport. The taxi cost us â‚¬47.00 from the airport to the hotel. And the trams were â‚¬7.00 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Value - Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Lis5556
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night here while visiting Amsterdam and while most people complain it is outside of the city it's not that bad (approx 18 EURO cab ride which is nothing when you split it among 4 people or it's conveniently located near public transit if you prefer). The rooms were quite small (meaning I could probably stretch out my arms and touch both sides) but that was no big deal. Everything looked to be recently renovated and the hotel was extremely clean. The staff was so helpful and amazing. Had a great night sleep here and would definitley stay again

Reviews.Title: “Receptionists go above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Jewelsworld
Reviews.Content: The Blue Square Hotel is just what the name implies - a huge blue square on a quiet main street in a largely Muslim neighborhood full of families. Due to a big conference in town, the choice of hotels was slim and we had a large group to accommodate. The Blue Square would not have been our first choice as it was so far from the city centre but they were able to take all of us and the rate was quite reasonable. If you are going to be stuck on the outskirts of Amsterdam, you could do a lot worse. The #7 and #14 trams as well as the #21 bus all picked-up just a block away for a 25 minute ride into the city centre. Rooms are large and well-appointed by European standards (we stayed in a double room for two nights and then moved to a triple when part of our group headed home). The beds were spongy soft but comfy and the pillows somewhat lumpy. Lighting was okay but the bedside light which is designed to have three settings so one person can read while the other sleeps, had only completely 'off' or 'on'. It was also missing shades but a call to the front desk remedied that situation quite quickly. Lighting in the bathroom was only adequate. Housekeeping was a bit remiss. I've noticed lately that hotels are taking 'green' living just a bit too far at times. Tightening up beds using the same linens is fine with me for a day or two but leaving used utensils like coffee mugs and spoons is not. And the extra pillows we found in a cupboard were soiled with old blood spots. We left a note to have them exchanged but that never happened - nor did they ever provide pillow cases for the extra pillows. Ugh! We have to give the receptionists a hearty round of applause - it appears that their job description not only included checking people in and out but they also act as bell captain, concierge and general trouble-shooters. When we arrived our room wasn't ready and the gal at the front desk got a key and showed us to the luggage room and helped us stack our suitcases within. She later helped us to retrieve them as well. When I had a problem with my TV remote, the guy from the front desk appeared with a replacement apologizing for the wait as he had several phone calls and check-ins. They did a great job and all spoke English quite well. Breakfast is offered at the hotel but for an astounding rate of 15 Euro per person at the time of this review. We found a lovely bakery down the street and later stopped at a grocery store just off the tram line and were able to provide breakfast for ourselves for four mornings for a total of 10 Euro for all three of us. Since there was a coffee maker in the room, this was definitely worth giving up eggs and sausage for a few days! I was actually quite surprised that they charged for breakfast as most hotels I stay at in Europe include a huge breakfast with your hotel stay. A couple people in our group asked if they could just get coffee one morning and were told it would cost the whole 15 Euro to do that. A trip to the front desk and a chat with one of the 'Jack of all Trades' Receptionists provided each member of our group with some coffee gratis. One thing that can be said about the Blue Square (besides their awesome reception staff) is that they had the very best Wi-Fi I have ever had in any hotel anywhere in the world and it was gratifyingly free. If you must stay on the outskirts of Amsterdam, the Blue Square is a good choice. The tram is 2.60 Euro and you can buy your card on the tram when you board. If this is your first trip to Amsterdam and you are planning to see all the sites, buy an iAmsterdam card - they come in 1,2 and 3 day packages and not only do you get entry to most of the museums, you also get free public transportation. At the time of this review, the 3-day pass was $59 and I nearly got double the price out of it. A very worthwhile expenditure. Hint: buy it on-line as the wait at the tourist office can be horrendous - nearly two hours! Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but very far from the city centre.”
Reviews.Author: Maverick145
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 other friends for just one night. We had taken a triple room but were upgraded to a quadruple room when we arrived. The room was big and spacious with a large window and proper air conditioning. The hotel staff were very helpful and cheerful. The problem was the bathroom which was too small for the room. I mean the space could have been really utilized better. It was very difficult to take a shower with the restricted space. And the other issue was the distance of the hotel from the city center. It is quite far and not really well connected. Overall, its definitely a good hotel except for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Was going OK until...”
Reviews.Author: Gillie22
Reviews.Content: Right. This is clearly a cost effective hotel. If you're on a budget - it's reasonable. However these are some key points that need your consideration: - The location is terrible. A local on a tram said as we were disembarking, "Oh no, you don't want to stay in this part of town..." - Upon leaving (in a bus headed for Berlin that wasn't going to turn around and go back), I realised I had rather stupidly left my phone on the bedside table. No problem, we'll use another phone to ring them and ask them to forward the phone to a hotel we'll be staying at in just over a week. They told us they would check the room and call us back to make arrangements. They didn't call back, so we rang them again after 2 hours only to be told that the phone wasn't found. They said, "you should check your pockets in the pants you were wearing yesterday." Hmmm, why didn't I think of that? (I did - the phone was left on the bedside table!!!) So... they either have a security issue where unauthorised persons have access to rooms once you check-out or they have a security issue where authorised persons are very industrious. Either way, stay at this hotel at your own risk. Surely there is somewhere closer to town that offers better security?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Bloom_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my teenage son after reading other reviews on Tripadvisor. As others have said pretty uninspiring from the outside ( a blue box) but perfectly fine inside. We found the hotel to be spotlessly clean. The maid left the room like a new pin every day. Bathroom pristine, and I am picky! Comfy beds, tea & coffee supplies & flat screen TV in room. Very helpful staff, all speak good English. Buffet breakfast was OK, would avoid the hot food as with all mass catering hot food in a warmer tends to go rubbery, but plenty of other options. Hotel is a 20 min tram ride from the centre of Amsterdam, which suited us fine. Situated in an ethnic (mainly Turkish area) which felt safe to walk around. Handy shopping centre, and we ate at local restaurants every night. Well priced and nice food at all of them. Best was the Ada Lunch Restaurant just behind the hotel which had fabulous food & courteous service. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just like expected”
Reviews.Author: Vonderwall
Reviews.Content: Considering the price this hotel is not so far from the center (20 minutes with the tram). There is a shopping center near the hotel, you can also go to the city center on bike in less than 30 minutes crossing different parks. The staff is helpful and the rooms are nice even if the hotel looks like a giant blue Lego building from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: UckfieldSue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend from the US and her 18 year old son. We chose it as it was a good price for a 4 star hotel, although about a 20 minute tram/bus ride from the city centre. It did not feel like a 4 star and, had we known, we would have opted for a 3 star hotel nearer to the city centre. However, the hotel was clean, good (not great) service, and a good buffet breakfast. The best part was that we had a triple room with 3 proper beds, not a twin with a put-you-up.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by the inside”
Reviews.Author: Nogranny
Reviews.Content: As many others have said. There is nothing to make you think it is going to be a nice hotel by the outward appearance. But the inside is modern and we have a lovely view of the canal. The rooms were adequate and the bathroom had plenty of room to get ready, even by American standards. It was located close to public transport and right next to a market/mall like area. It was about a 15-20 minute ride to the "downtown" area of Amsterdam. Beds were comfortable and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel would definately return”
Reviews.Author: wyaloa Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We recently had en enjoyable stay at the Blue Square Hotel. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, the amenities were satisfactory and the food was good, particularly the restaurant which was reasonably priced for Amsterdam and served decent quality food. The location was a bit out of the way and that is reflected in the price, however the local tram system was so good we had no trouble getting in and out of the city centre. The staff were both friendly and helpful, we would certainly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Jmast0626
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Europe for 2 weeks with our best friend and were part of a Contiki tour. We stayed here for 2 nights and were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Our room was quite large-similar to American-style hotel rooms and the bathroom was quite gorgeous. The decor was tasteful and the rooms were very clean. The hotel is a bit outside of Amsterdam but is near a bus stop. Thankfully we had a tour coach that took us in and out of town. The included breakfast was ok.. nothing special but edible. This was our best hotel on the tour. My only complaint was that our room was street level which concerned me a bit security-wise but I think we were in a decent part of town and nothing bad happened so all worked out well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: Ryan074
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night. Good size room, nothing to amazing. The building has a weird layout so some of the rooms dont really have a veiw besides for the room across a small courtyard. We asked to switch rooms which they did do for us. They had a car park under the hotel which was nice. Wifi in the rooms as well. Rooms where clean and comfortable. Location was about 7km outside the main part of the city, which we rented bikes and rode into town one day, and took the bus as well which didnt take long either. Had a full breakfast with many options to pick from. Only thing I dont get is that they considered a double bed just two beds pushed together?? Also I had left behind some items in the room which they found and then mailed everything that I left to me, nothing missing. I had to pay for the shipping cost but was a small price to pay to get everything back. Overall I would prolly stay there again if I couldnt find anything closer to the city for the same price. They also had a bag storage for no extra charge, so after we checked out we left our bags in a room and went back out sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: MrsC333
Reviews.Content: Other than being a bit out of the city I can not fault much else about this hotel. Friendly, clean and free wi-fi I was pleasantly impressed. Be prepared for a cab ride of about 20 euro to town but it is worth what it costs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit expensive and in the outskirts”
Reviews.Author: email4Sujit
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel. We loved the stay. But very expensive compared to other European cities. This hotel is far from Amsterdam city's major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireEngland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of an EasyJet package and found it easily on the outskirts following a train and tram ride from the airport. NOT central, but about 20 minutes out, we enjoyed the location in what appeared to be a very Turkish area - Our room looked out at 2 different waterways and the Turkish restaurant on a jetty into the water provided a superb supper (not licenced). Other evenings we went to the Egyptian Tutankhamun opposite (spelled differently) where staff were very friendly and efficient and the food was good. The hotel room was excellent, as were the breakfasts and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wmacetheace
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a Contiki tour. Check-in was easy, arrived on a late afternoon. Don't let the blue outside fool you. The hotel was very nice. Nice lobby, free wifi, had a room on the second floor. Room was spacious, clean, decor was updated, bathroom was very nice, large walk in shower. Staff was friendly, restaurant was ok too. Location is away from main city, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smoothyworld
Reviews.Content: Hotel was pretty decent I found. It is located in the Amsterdam suburbs, which means you need to catch a tram to get into the centre. The area isn't exactly amazing but it's not run down and you don't feel totally unsafe walking around. The room I stayed in was very clean, however it was a pity to see that the ceiling has clearly had water damage at some point and there was exposed wires (still in the "jacket" though) leading from the wall to the mirror spot lights in the bathroom. To be fair though, the rest of the room was spotless and everyone worked as it should have so no complaints there. The breakfast was good, with continental breakfast and "fry ups"-style breakfast also available, which should satisfy everyone's tastes. There was also free wifi in the hotel, although it was a struggle to get a reliable signal in the bedroom. All in all, a decent hotel that should be considered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you do not mind staying outside the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: lorddodo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was a good deal. When we arrived, we found the hotel to be situated in a fairly quiet suburb with a cheerful marketplace nearby. Staff at the hotel were pleasant and helpful. Our room was spacious, the beds comfortable, and to our surprise, there was a teas-made! Excellent links to the city centre via tram or bus available-takes approximately 30 minutes to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, far from centre”
Reviews.Author: franandhow
Reviews.Content: The main reason we booked this hotel was that all the central hotel were so expensive, so we knew the distance from town was about a 20 min tram ride, but you do get used to it....we knew the distance and we thought the price difference was worth the journey. The pain was that if you wanted to get showered and changed for the evening then return to the centre, it was a good hour and a half to do that. The area the hotel is in is quite good, there is a small market by the hotel and a small shopping centre and supermarket. The hotel was clean and friendly, the breakfast was quite a high standard to be honest, better than I thought it would be as breakfast was included in the rate we paid. Rooms were clean but compact, staff were friendly........So if you after a budget priced 4*, clean, modern hotel and you dont mind a 20 min tram journey to Dam Square this is for you. Enjoy :).

Reviews.Title: “Good big room - Location to train station not ideal.”
Reviews.Author: ddrCanada
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Blue Square was a great hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful with the public transportation system to get to Dam Square. Breakfast was good but it did cost about 15 Euro, but good variety. The room was the size of a North American hotel room and it was very clean. The bathroom was also very clean. The bed and pillows were good as well. Location was not ideal for getting to Dam Square or the train station. We had to take a cab to get to the hotel and after that we took the bus. There was a good Eqyptian style restaurant across the street. Liked - Helpful staff, good breakfast and room Disliked - Location; having to take the bus

Reviews.Title: “valuables are stolen in mystery, not safe place”
Reviews.Author: gezerdurur
Reviews.Content: we stayed at that hotel in last november. at first everything was ok. Ä±t Ä±s really far away from the centre but ok. however, on our last they all our belongings were stolen, even some of our clothes. the manager did not help us except reminding us that it was our fault??? how I really don't know. because there wasn't any problems with our door and it was locked. she claimed that we could have been left the window open, which is a very stupid idea in winter time in Amsterdam. so ok Ä±t Ä±s really affordable and we learnt its reason in an annoying way

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, newly renovated rooms!”
Reviews.Author: LCToronto_11
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous, clearly someone has invested alot into this property. From the outside it looks like a dingy, giant blue block, but the inside is comfortably decorated in a modern contemporary style. The Beds were very comfortable and the cozy rooms were nicely furnished with everything a traveler can expect in a short term stay hotel. I was traveling with a friend, and it was nice that the two single beds were separated by a small privacy wall. The location is great. Its not nearly downtown, but it is in a nice quiet area and the Tram stops right in front, and it is very easy to navigate the city. We had a great, enjoyable stay and I will definitely be returning on my next trip to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: weed4all Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days in this hotel recently and it was great. The staff were friendly and the room was comfortable and quiet. The breakfast was also good. Was taking taxi to and from center and that costs ca 20euro each way. You can take the tram if you dont mind and that costs only 2euro each way and public transportation tickets can be bought at the reception. I also read somewhere that you can rent bicycle there or nearby which I will be doing in my next stay here. When I was checking out and had like 6-7hrs before my flight went I asked them to store my luggage in the hotel meanwhile, although I was no longer a guest staying there this was no problem and was sorted swiftly. Going out one night I asked a reception guy or hotel manager or whatever standing near the reception desk where I could find different places and upon returning to the hotel again he was greeting me at the door, I was so stoned coming back I dident hear him at first so he stopped me at the door asking me if I found these places I was looking for and was extremely helpful and positive. Overall one of the best hotels Ive stayed in. Great, helpful and serviceminded staff with great and affordable rooms that has nice bathroom and very comfy beds, tea/coffee making in room and also controlable aircon thing in room you can configure as much as you want. Im going back to Amsterdam in little over a month again, although last time I was there was my first time in Amsterdam I will still most likely be going back to the excact same spot again over any other because I know this one is great, its nice comfy and has affordable price. Thank you for giving me a great stay at your hotel and a positive expirience. Best regards! Until next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarkBStAlbans
Reviews.Content: I would certainly recommend the hotel. Good sized rooms that were well cleaned daily. Very comfortable bed and extra chairs in the room. Little short on hanging space if you are there for a longer period (we were struggling at 4 nights) but other storage available. The location was a concern but it turned out fine. We got a Connexion transfer from the airport (book a return - great value at 50 Euro for 2) and getting into the centre of Amsterdam or any of the other districts is very easy using the excellent tram system. Do not let location put you off. We had breakfast in the hotel (included in price) and it was a reasonable spread although not extensive. It was replenished regularly right up till the last time of admittance. Hotel staff very helpful with sights and directions and even provided some money off vouchers for some of the attractions we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel at a fabulous price”
Reviews.Author: t_gallaher
Reviews.Content: We originally booked another hotel but changed to this one, the service we received was excellent. The room was comfortable and clean. One of the best hotel beds we have ever slept in!!!! Breakfast was of excellent choice and quality. Staff were more than helpful and friendly Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: FrancescaDent
Reviews.Content: This was not the hotel we originally booked for our stay in amsterdam as after reading awful reviews about our original hotel we decided to book a different place to stay. We arrived at the hotel at around 9:30pm and were greeted by friendly staff who were very helpful when we had questions about getting into the city centre. Our room was very clean and comfortable. We were shocked at how nice the room was for the amount we paid. The room was cleaned and the towels changed daily. On our first night, there was a broken lightbulb in the bathroom which was fixed the next day without us having to ask. Although the hotel is a little way out of the city centre, there are trams and buses which run regularly and are always on time so don't let distance put you off. Our only issue was when it came to leaving. The hotel offer a taxi service to the airport and we booked our taxi the night before we were due to leave. After checking out and waiting quite a while for our taxi, a member of staff at the hotel asked what time our taxi was booked for and when we said it was 5 minutes late, phoned the taxi company to check where our taxi was. She informed us that they didnt have us on their list but they would be here as soon as possible. This was not the hotels fault, more a case of people getting their wires crossed. This hotel was not our original choice. After reading awful reviews on our original booking we decided to change to this hotel and we are so glad that we did. We had a fabulous stay and would definately return to this hotel in the futre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel just abit too far from Centre”
Reviews.Author: KirstyNorthampton
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel couldn't fault it one bit just a little out of the way from the centre. However it is more than easily reached by trams & buses outside the hotel.Fab weekend away and the Dutch are some of the nice people i have ever met!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing price/quality ratio, with some weirdness”
Reviews.Author: DriftSK
Reviews.Content: I've been at the Blue Square for three weeks on business, leaving for weekends only and then back on Sundays, and my experience is largely positive. First thing, this hotel delivers an overall 4-stars experience at 3-stars price if you catch the right offer; it is well served by public transportation; it has a strict non-smoking policy; and it offers free wireless connectivity, which is a huge plus (although signal may become weak and spotty at times in some rooms). Keep in mind the surroundings are not exciting (to say the least). I've been in different rooms and they were all spacious, comfortable and very quiet; south wing may be noisier due to road traffic, and those featuring big windows require some extra heating (just crank it up a little). I've had some weird moments too. At checkin time on a Sunday evening I've once been given a room that smelled like an entire army had been smoking inside it all day long, and I've had it changed promptly on request. Later the same week I entered my room in late afternoon only to find out someone had been smoking inside it (!), again had to report to the manager who immediately offered to change it or have it cleaned with a spray (I chose the latter and it worked); still have to understand who the smoker was... I can only assume it's been the chamber maid. And lastly I've been given a room where climate control was broken (fixed the day after) and the desk had no chair (brought immediately on request). I have to underline the staff has always been helpful and nice while solving those minor issues. Albeit not perfect, this hotel can't possibly be beaten thanks to its outstanding price/quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtravelers037
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on a Contiki Tour. Our room had 3 beds, 2 singles pushed together and then 1 single by itself. It was a very nice/ modern spacious room with a view of the river. The bathroom was fairly spacious and newer! The buffet here was good!! (ex. chicken, meatballs, fries, pasta, salad, bread) Breakfast is included. (fruit, toast, tomatoes, lettuce, meats, cheese - your typical european breakfast spread) There was a safe in our room (where you can program our own code) There were elevetors and had 1 computer you could use in the lobby with internet. Only a few minutes from downtown/ red light district. We took a cab back to the hotel after our evening out and it was approx. $10 Euro from the red light district.

Reviews.Title: “It is ok”
Reviews.Author: henider
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel. The rooms are very spacious, the staff is extremely helpful. The location is ok, convienient to get into the city center with tram. Free WiFi is fast and easy access. My room was very dark and the wardrobe door seemed dirty, but bathroom was cleaned and the floor, lining etc also. You could also park under the hotel, but have to be paid for. Have to be sad, it is a scraffy old hotel and found the price overrated. (as it is mainly in Amsterdam)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, clean comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: emmab85
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel at the last stop of our tour. It was the best hotel we had stayed at. the rooms were great the beds were so comfortable. Each room had a coffee maker with free coffee/tea/hot chocolate. The hotel staff was great they were very helpful with figuring out the tram. (streetcar). The hotel lobby and decor is great and in the lobby there was free internet. The location wasnt the best but a tram stop was jsut around the corner so once you figure out how to get around it is great!.

Reviews.Title: “was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: maulihua
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, I was worried that I had booked the wrong place to stay but on arrival (6 a.m.) we received a warm welcome, all the staff were very helpful and the room was spacious. The beds are sooooo comfortable with decent pillows. Bathroom clean and also spacious. Breakfast was your usual buffet style and again no complaints. No minibar in room and bring your own toothbrush and paste. The location for an affordable hotel in Amsterdam was great. 15 minutes by bus into Central Amsterdam and that was driving on icey roads, and 20 to 30 minutes by tram, both tram and bus stops were an easy walk from hotel and we purchased 72 hours (15.50 euro) travel cards which made getting on and off a breeze. Shopping within the vicinity of the hotel for meals, snacks and other essentials no problem, there is an ATM near the trams/bus stop. Aldi foodmart is 2 minute walk from hotel and an outdoor market (weather permitting) 1 minute walk. Free internet WiFi throughout the hotel. Just one thing, if you really can't do without smoking in your room, then perhaps look for another hotel. This hotel IS totally non-smoking. There is a smoking area outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bgprusty
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonable hotel with worst staff at the reception!!! Beaware of getting ripped off while checking out.. Ask them clearly about the charges prior to signing the papers or handing over your credit card details.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but far from city center”
Reviews.Author: Astroph
Reviews.Content: The room was nice. The layout was a bit weird but was still comfortable. The air conditioning worked great and kept the room nice and cool in the summer. Breakfast was nice. Nice hotel, but the location is pretty far from the city center and will cost you a lot to take a taxi to and from the center.

Reviews.Title: “good, nice, simple, no problems”
Reviews.Author: james160987
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 3 nights, Good value, some info for people i think might be usefull, Once at central sation outside- a) walk to dam square, get tram 14, right hand side of the palace, stop plein 40-45 or the one after ( both are 2 mins walk from hotel) b) take bus 21a , - central station to plein 40-45, heating - no issue, room and hotel warm, breakfast- ok - could do with some sauguages and hash browns, journey times - approx 20-25 mins by tram night bus, central station bus 352 to gwen(something) all correct as of 30 november, i normally stay closer to the centre at a 2 star hotel, this beats in in everyway, room, shower etc, only minor annoyance was the tram ride but i used ot have a 15 min walk to my hotel from dam square so 20-25 min tram in the warm was fine, bed was looooovvlllyyyy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Book for a quality stay in the Netherlands!”
Reviews.Author: misslucy21
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Blue Square hotel and had to write a good review. lovely clean hotel, rooms are comfortable and clean and the area is so quiet that you sleep soundly! 2 tram services and a bus service take you into the centre and take approx. 15 mins which is perfect as the public transport system is first class in the Netherlands and there is a regular night bus taking you back to the hotel after 12.30am! All staff were lovely and very helpful, definatelty recommend the hotel to future travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: anisenkolkata0310
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after having stayed at their property in Zhenjiang China. This Chain of hotels offers the business and leisure traveller various options to suit their budget. The Blue Square property is located near Sloterdijk railway station which serves as a strong connection to Schiphol airport. The rooms are well stocked to cater to a traveller's needs and their front desk is equally entusiastic to help guests. The best thing about this hotel is its location. A 20 min tram ride from outside the hotel takes you to the Museum district, Anne Frank's museum and Central Station. There are lots of eateries near the hotel to suit the budget traveller. As I was on leisure trip, I opted out of their in-house breakfast and had it outside as per my choice. The best thing about this hotel was its tremendously fast internet service. With Wi-Fi, I downloaded 900MB movies in about an hour or so. That was impressive!! The hotel arranges for daily commuting tickets and also package tickets for sighseeing purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay in Blue Square hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunidaze
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed in this hotel and its just as good as it was fhe first time... Easy access into the city by tram or bus which takes about 20 minutes, We had a good room well furnished twin beds .. staff are very good and the breakfast ... excellent ! everything from salads, cooked meats to the traditional fry up ! along with breads croissants etc etc.. we paid Â£50 a night ... you will definately not get better at that price in the centre of Amsterdam so its worth the 20 minute tram ride.. If you turn right outside the hotel towards Aldi supermarket on the crossroads there are a couple of very good restaurants with attentive staff, .. the area is ok its not scruffy at all , just a normal area on the outskirts of the city ..

Reviews.Title: “Far from the City”
Reviews.Author: globeseller
Reviews.Content: This hotel has full capacity. I tried to get an adapter so I can charge my cell phone but they are out of it. No service at night. For the money you are paying which is around 130 euro. You are better off getting a hotel closer to the city of amsterdam. At night there is no restaurant around the block that is open. There is a 24 hour store across that sells a 3.00eu small bottle water. No activity outside the hotel or sights to see. Expect no service hospitality from the front desk except to sleep at night and go on your way the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Beautiful hotel located close to the sights”
Reviews.Author: annalisajb
Reviews.Content: Blue Square hotel was our favorite accomodation during our entire Western Europe escapade. From the front desk service to the food and room comfort, all hit our expectations. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. Bathroom was pristine! Not to mention the amazingly comfortable beds. Recommend all the way! However, don't expect great service at the restaurant. If the food wasn't as good as it was, I would've said not to bother.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, out of the centre, but well served by public transport”
Reviews.Author: Dawn2000
Reviews.Content: We were a bit wary on arrival at this hotel, as the area does not appear to be the best on initial inspection; however we were won over quickly. The area is out of town; however well served by trams and buses. I note that an earlier reviewer mentioned the trams stop at 12 - this is true, but there are night buses throughout the night. Hotel was clean, rooms comfortable and the ones at the rear have a lovely view of a small canal with house boats. Staff were always helpful, providing extra pillows etc on request, giving directions and free maps of the city. We didn't eat in the hotel, so can't comment on the food there; however there are two cafe's extremely close by, one with outdoor seating if the weather is nice. Both offered good value for money, especially the one in the shopping centre, which has supermarkets, newsagents and a C & A among other shops. Overall felt this was a great deal if you don't mind 20 minutes on the tram into town. It's also good for people with mobility issues, as everywhere in the centre has very steep stairs, whilst this hotel has a lift and a ramp for wheelchair entry.

Reviews.Title: “gret experience”
Reviews.Author: tatman45
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for 5 nights staff were very friendly rooms were clean breakfasts were great

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Ordel
Reviews.Content: We had a little problem finding the hotel initially but after our first visit we were ok. The hotel is about 20minutes from the city center but the tram and bus service is excellent so you wont have a problem getting around. The only draw back is that the bus & tram end their service to that area at 12midnight so if you plan to stay out late then you have to get a cab. The staff is very helpful and courteous, the breakfast is also very good. I had a double room and the single beds are extremely small and the carpet in the hall way leading to the room needs changing. The area where the hotel is located is very boring and its also hard to get food in that area. Overall the hotel is very nice and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly nice clean rooms a little bit out of the city”
Reviews.Author: Krissishi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2010. Wasnt expecting much but was pleasantly surprised by our very modern and clean room. Very comfortable and quiet. They had free internet on 2 computers in the lobby. Not the best of locations as its a little bit out of Amsterdam but if you have the means to get into the city, would def recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Get past the blue color!”
Reviews.Author: Tropicanza
Reviews.Content: Best Western Blue Square Hotel Is a very colorful hotel by colorful I mean the only color you see is blue. It is a very big hotel and has two single beds and one king size bed. From the outside all you can say is where am I but after a few days it feels like a very homey place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - a short journey to city centre - great city tho !!!”
Reviews.Author: Nay_1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the blue square for the weekend with friends. The hotel was lovely and clean. The room was good, however the view was of nothing but we were not in the room for very long we were just pleased there was 3 beds and a shower! The cleaning staff seemed a little lazy as we had to ask for more milk in the rooms and an extra cup on a couple of days - nothing really bad tho!! But overall hotel was good, comfortable and helpful. There isnt much around the hotel area, a few shops and cafes but the shops in the little shopping centre have strange opening times so check b4 you set out to look round them. To get to the Amsterdam city centre you can catch the bus or tram. You can catch the number 21 bus or tram 14. It is really easy and I didn't have to wait much more 3 mins for a bus/tram. Get a travel pass - easier and cheaper, rather than having to pay for a single trip each time. Few suggestions of things to see and do - Anne Frank house -excellent. Boat cruise - interesting and relaxing. Pub crawl - get to see red light district. Sex museum - very funny

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-nice people-wrong location”
Reviews.Author: janbyl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean staff are very friendly the only problem is the location especially at night it could feel a little intimidating, the tutankhamun restaurant over the road from the hotel was very nice if you like turkish food the 14 and 7 tram take you into amsterdam and take about 20 minutes there are also a couple of buses my advice is to get the train from schipol to central station then get the number 64 bus to slotermeer. it is a good hotel on a budget but the travel costs maybe mean the euros you save staying here might be better spent staying central amsterdam, is the most expensive city i have stayed in, in europe

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel despite the front facade!”
Reviews.Author: JenMcCarthy23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really clean, very central - right next to the metro line. Our room was small but modern and neat. There is a supermarket across the street and the hotel is fairly close to all the main attractions. Would recommend it for those travelling on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “It's a gorgeous hotel with a really nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: jazzgirl32
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with our airline/credit card points and it was beautiful! It definitely is a 4 star hotel. The staff is so nice and helpful, and they are proficient in English. The rooms are average in size, but are decorated very nicely. The breakfast buffet is awesome - one of the best I've seen in Europe, so if you're wondering about that, it's probably worth it. The location is a bit far, but it's one tram ride into Dam Square (22-25 minutes), and you catch the tram down the road. There are also night buses that the hotel can help you with if you want to stay out late. It's no problem to transport to and from the hotel. You can also take a bus like the website says from the main station to get there, as if you are arriving from the central station, you'd have to take 2 trams to get to the hotel. Take the bus if you have luggage. If not, you could walk up to Dam square and do only 1 tram. Free wi-fi all around the hotel. It was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the value”
Reviews.Author: GinnyMYpsilanti_MI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit out of the way, but if you get bus/tram passes you can save money on transportation. The rooms are large and the bathrooms huge!! The staff is friendly, speak perfect English and can answer every question you have without hesitation!! Totally recommend if you are on a budget!!

Reviews.Title: “Really really pleased we picked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tishipus
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly and helpful staff, fantastically big rooms, clean, well equipped, fabulous shower, incredibly comfy and enormous double bed.....views from the room lovely (canal one side and lake the other), very quiet and peaceful surroundings. Would I stay again? absolutely! Yes it is a little out of town but the trams stop two mins up the street and the staff will give you a map with a list of which trams and buses go where, they run very regularly so you never have to wait long. Get a chip card from tourist information which will give you unlimited travel for 24, 48 hours or however long you want and then you just swipe it when you get on (and off) the tram or bus. I will definitely stay here again when we visit next, much better than those pokey expensive hotels in town!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, quite far out of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: buds_nz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Contiki tour - the rooms were very good, with excellent bathrooms, free wi-fi, and good range of TV channels. The restaurant buffet was basic, but good - both dinner and breakfast. This hotel is a 20 minute tram ride from the centre of town, so it's probably not suited for city breaks or romantic getaways, and in fact it seemed to have a number of other large tour groups there as well. There were a few bars across the road, but no real nightlife to speak of in the local vicinity. Overall we were happy with the quality and standard of this hotel and it's facilities, though as I mentioned it's quite far out of the city so that's something to consider.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: annabas
Reviews.Content: me and my friends went to amsterdam for five days, we stayed at blue square hotel, my room was very nice and had lovely view! It was clear and cosy! The breakfast was very tasty! I recomend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great staff, very clean and free wi-fi!”
Reviews.Author: Dee2469
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Blue Square Hotel. At first we were a bit worried about the distance from central Amsterdam but the tram goes past the front of the hotel and it takes 20 minutes to get into town. With a 3 day, unlimited travel ticket being 15 Euro, this was not a problem at all. The hotel had free wi-fi which was fantastic. It made keeping in touch with friends and family so easy and convenient. There were a couple of eating places nearby but not many.
