However, with the convenience of the tram this didn't matter because getting into central Amsterdam was so simple. The hotel had a small bar, open every night and I have to say, it's the cheapest hotel bar in all the places of have stayed worldwide. About .4.50 Euro for spirits with a mixer. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Our room was very quiet and the hot breakfasts were fantastic. I would definitely stay here again. The people who complain about the location of the Blue Square should remember why they stayed there. Because hotel of the same quality in central Amsterdam are very expensive and so they looked for somewhere cheaper. The Blue Square is cheaper because of it's location but the quality makes up for the distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: iluvdmb
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in Holland over the Easter weekend. We decided to leave our industrial town and head to Amsterdam. Trying to be mindful of our company's expense we decided to stay outside of the city. We chose Ble Square because it sounded like a good alternative. Not so. The neighborhood is very diverse to say the least. There were NO resteraunts at all. The hotel resteraunt is ok but limited. Our rooms were on the street and it was very noisy. I would not recommend this hotel as an alternative to staying in city center. Do your research and you can find something downton for sure. We actually didn't save any money because we had to take the bus back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel just 20 minute tram ride from centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sunidaze
Reviews.Content: To get to this hotel is easy, a choice of two trams that leave from Amsterdam centre to 50 yds from hotel, or get off the train from Schipol airport at Sloterdjik station and get a number 19 bus to hotel... The hotel is in not a bad area, there are some good shops , a few cafes , an Aldi supermarket and an outdoor market all within 200yds ... you can buy what you need at half the price of Amsterdam city centre shops...The hotel is not in a tourist area so you will not find any "coffee shops" closeby, if you want to purchase cheap alchohol for your room then just nip up to Aldi. The buses and trams run every ten minutes into Amsterdam city centre and after midnight there is a "night bus" ... all details will be given to you by the very helpful staff on reception.. The foyer of the hotel is very attractive, marble floors and walls, the bar and lounge is modern and comfortable, there is a lift and stairs to all floors. Our room was lovely with one of the most comfortable beds i have ever slept in ! flat screen tv , tasteful furniture and a very good large shower in the bathroom, tea and coffee making facilities are also provided. The breakfast is excellent, hot and cold help yourself buffet with cereals and fruit juice and a variety of breads, definately no complaints there !! On our arrival we were presented with a voucher that gave us free meals on the night of our arrival in the a la carte restaurant to the value of 22 euros each, the food was lovely , i had rack of lamb and my husband had sea bass as our main courses.. If you dont mind the twenty minute tram ride (you can buy a card for 7 euros) which is excellent value, and can be used for multiple journeys then i would definately recommend this hotel, you get so much more value than staying in Amsterdam centre and paying a fortune for a room the size of a postage stamp... Including flights from Birmingham and two nights in hotel plus free dinner and excellent breakfast we paid a total of Â£100 each which for Amsterdam is pretty good .

Reviews.Title: “clean and great bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2x4
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults & 2 Children) stayed here as part of a Trafalgar tour for 1 night. Our room had 4 single beds and was huge. The bathroom was also very big. The breakfast was lovely and fresh with plenty of food. Would Recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, a cheaper alternative to central amsterdam hotels”
Reviews.Author: sam_king86
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 days in Amsterdam in November, and struggled to find a hotel with good reviews that didnt cost the earth, which led me to the blue square hotel, which due not not being in the centre, is far cheaper and a perfect place to stay. The hotel is in the outskirts of Amsterdam, but is only a very short tram (number 14, 7) or bus (number 21) ride away, the drivers all know where the hotel is and were quite happy to let you know when you need to get off. The hotel itself is a converted office block, hence the strange look of the place, and is much nicer on the inside than the outside. The reception area is very smart and also contains the bar, also on the ground floor is the restaurant where the buffet breakfast is a must, with fantastic choice of hot and cold food. The hotel is a doughnut shape, with rooms facing either into a courtyard, onto the street or onto a canal behind, we were in a room facing into the courtyard and was very quiet and still very private. The rooms were large and had fairly nice dark wooden furnature, not the usual cheap built in stuff that you would usually expect of a chain hotel. The bed was one of the most comfortable i have ever slept in. The en-suite bathroom was adequate, and the shower was amazing and was huge. All in all the room was fantastic and could not fault it. The only thing we were disappointed with was the evening meal in the hotel, We only ate in one night, and the choice was limited and expensive, and to be honest was not great. There is very limited places to eat without going into the centre which is worth it, as the choice is fantastic, although be prepared, amsterdam is a very expensive city. There are a number of shops in the small shopping centre next door including a small supermarket, and gorgeous bakery. As for getting around, I highly recommend buying GVB travel card which allows travel on the local trains, trams and most buses, you can buy these from reception and only arounf 18 euros for 4 days, which was a bargain, and by far the cheapest way of getting about. These are available from most stations. All in all, a fantasic hotel which is a really pleasent place to stay, without the cost of a central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff, close to transport and convenience stores but...”
Reviews.Author: brodinatorama
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying that I stayed at the Blue Square Hotel as a leg of a Contiki Tour, so based on previous hotel standards I did not expect much out of this hotel AT ALL! However, it then exceeded my expectations.... in a really good way. My first thought after walking into the reception area was 'Fancy', a huge change from what we had been used too on our tour. When me and my boyfriend walked into our room we had been put in a room with two single beds, not that I cared too much, a hotel is only a place to rest your head. And an awesome rest it was, the beds were amazingly comfortable, and the pillows were by far the best on the trip. The bathroom was very small, but the shower was amazing, good temperature control and water pressure. Another suprise from a European hotel. The staff in this hotel were friendly and more then wiling to assist me with any questions I had. From memory they have a free wireless network in the hotel, they also had computers for free use in the reception area. So tick tick! The breakfast here was pretty good, once again, better then other hotels I had stayed in. It was right next store to an Aldi and other supermarkets, pharmacys etc, which came in handy. Despite this hotel's close proximity to public transport.... is it a long way from the center of town. It took us 25mins + to get into the center, which put a bit of a downer on trip, and was a huge pain when you were tired and ready to hit the hay. Another bad thing about its distance from the center of town, was that after the trams stopped running at about 12.30.... the options to get back to the hotel were limited. We didn't quite get the bus system, and some people we were with got ripped off by taxi drivers because we had no idea about what we were sposed to pay to get back to the hotel. So despite all it's good points, the comfort and great amenities, I was there to enjoy and experience Amsterdam, and I felt that maybe its distance from the center of town didn't allow me to take advantage of my short time there as much as I could have, or would liked to have. So if you are looking for great service, comfort, security and all that jazz at a reasonable price, this place could suit you. But if you are in Amsterdam for only a night or 2, get a hotel closer to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: marciofleury
Reviews.Content: Polite receptionists. Rooms and coletive spaces were pleasant, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a little poor for the price. Little far from the center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mosgorgnoj
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with friendly stuff (spoke to 3 different persons, all were willing to help) Very clean, renovated, very nice style inside. Its close to the supermarket. The only disatvantage is its location. Takes 15-20 minutes to get from the Central Station by bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: vanya-uk
Reviews.Content: We came across this hotel after days of searching the Net and finding negative reviews of every central hotel within our price range and decided to widen our search to outer Amsterdam. We were not all sure we had made the right choice until we arrived. It proved to be a very good choice indeed. Absolutely charming Reception staff who couldn't have been more helpful if they tried. Excellent and comfortable room with all the facilities we needed. Breakast was terrific with a huge range of dishes, and again here the staff were splendid. In spite of the fact it's outside the centre mattered not at all as there are three choices of tram routes to the Dam/Central Station. Two services stop almost right outside the door (7 & 14) and the 13 is a few minutes walk away. The service is excellent and you are whisked in to town very comfortably in 15/20 minutes. Gil Sutherland

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet hotel in the outskirts of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Dingdup
Reviews.Content: Being a Dutchie living abroad, I like to go shopping in the home country every now and again and for me, the location of the Blue Square hotel is excellent as it is easily accessible by public transport (to/from airport and city) and right next to a shopping centre. This means I can quickly buy the things I need, immediately drop them off at the hotel and then go to the city for some fun. It takes about half an hour to get there. Pro's - The hotel is pretty quiet , even on weekends so one can get a good night's sleep. - Decent rooms with good beds, TV, closet, coffee/tea facilities. No fridge. - Helpful staff - Free wi-fi Cons: - Although the bathroom was nice, I found it a bit dangerous. To take a shower one has to stand in the bathtub and it was quite slippery. Although I am young and have long, flexible legs, I also find the tubs pretty high to get in and out of and there is no bar to hold on to. Can imagine it would be a problem for some. - The dimmed lights in the room look nice, but are not very practical if you try to work or write something. - A bit cold at night, heating system did not function properly

Reviews.Title: “Much better than it looks”
Reviews.Author: IWright
Reviews.Content: From the outside this is one of the most ugly hotels i've ever seen and yes, it is far from the city centre, but do not let this put you off! Inside the hotel is really quite nice, our room was really lovely, spotlessly clean, amazing shower and one of the comfiest hotel beds i have ever slept in! The reception staff were very polite and friendly and very helpful when we had a problem with our security safe (although some were more helpful that others!)The hotel bar lacks atmosphere but is the same price for drinks as the pubs in town which i think is pretty unusual. There are no bars or restaurants nearby that are worth going to and i think that is a bit of a drawback as it meant we had to stay in the very expensive city centre. There is a supermarket close by which we did find useful. The Hotel is on a very easy bus and tram route (21 bus from central station, 14 tram from dam square, 7 tram to the Heinekin experience), just make sure to get off at plein 40-45 as this is the closest to the hotel. Also worth noting is that you can buy a transport pass from the airport when you arrive you allowing you free travel on the buses, trams and metros for the duration of you stay plus your train to and from the airport, this makes it an awful lot cheaper to get to and from the centre when you are staying a bit out of town as you are here. Overall, it is good value for money - nice, clean ,comfortable hotel, on a easy route to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Square made us blue”
Reviews.Author: Lena-and-Larry
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful stay at Best Western West in Oslo (three star), we expected this proclamed four star hotel to be better. The hotel should drop a few stars. We entered the lobby and noticed five Russian men following a drunk woman who was barely able to walk. The staff acted like they didn't notice this. We needed Wifi to manage some business matters via Internet. That was one of the reasons why we selected Blue Square. However, we couldn't get access to our email. The staff explained they recently "upgraded" their provider and couldn't understand why our email access was blocked. They assured us it would be fixed...it never was during our stay. Our room was never made, linen was never changed, used towels were never replaced, and the list goes on. Even the coffee pot and shelves were covered with dust. When my wife called the lobby, she was told the maid cleaned the rooms every three days. When they sent a maid to deliver fresh towels, my wife inquired again why the room was not cleaned, the maid stated they were "very busy" and normally clean it every day. She did offer to clean the room. Since it was past 9pm, we declined. Couldn't get a good night's sleep. People were opening and closing doors loudly during the middle of the night. Breakfast was bland and average. Comparing it to the "three-star" Best Western West in Oslo, the breakfasts in West totally blew away this so-called four-star buffet. This place is definately not worth its price. We'll tell our friends they'll get a better deal at a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “NICE AND CLEAN...IN A GHETTO”
Reviews.Author: DUTCHANDFREE54
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is not bad, the neighborhood it is in is awfull, and certainly NOT a place for families or female guests.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly nice for a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: DCJetsetter1210
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom and my Aunt for Spring Break in March of 2009. This hotel was a really nice surprise. The rooms were nice and the bar was great. I would recommend staying here when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: semihaserbest
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel. Me and my friend stayed there for 2 nights.The rooms were large and the beds were pretty comfortable. The bathroom was also large and clean. It's not near to downtown of Amsterdam but the tram is 5 min walk to the hotel. The staff is also very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Funky outside, Elegant Inside.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianWomanAbroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 nights (Sept 15 2009) Reserved online. Hotel was easy to find but parking was difficult to find. Also it cost 15 Euros per night to park. I thought that to be excessive. It is far from central amsterdam so not convenient if your purpose is to see the city sites and night life in a short time. Great if you are more leisurely. Strange looking from the outside, so really kind of cool. Very nice decor inside. All of the staff were friendly. Breakfast buffet was extra but very nice with a good selection of typical Dutch breakfast foods. The room itself was a good size, with 2 twin beds. My mother was happy, but I found mine to soft and everytime I rolled over, I rolled off. (I took points off room for that) Finally pulled my mattress to the floor and slept very comfortably. I know that sounds weird but at least it was clean enough that I felt comfortable to do that. The decor was clean and very attractive. The bathroom was spotless and lots of hot water. We couldn't hear any sounds from other rooms. There was AC and the windows opened. The hotel has free internet in the lobby. We travel to Netherlands about once per year, I would absolutely stay there again. The pictures of the rooms that the hotel posts are exactly what I saw and got.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, comfortable and good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: em_be53
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in July. Busy, busy hotel, but we found front desk staff to be extremely helpful printing out tickets for us and giving us good advice on where to eat and how to get around. Room was fine with 4 single beds which were all very comfortable. Clean and really all we needed for a base in Amsterdam. Also free wifi a plus! The hotel is located about 20 mins on the tram from the city - but it was never a problem for us. We enjoyed the short trip and felt safe walking back to the hotel late at night. There's a supermarket and laundramat close to the hotel and we used both. You should visit the Anne Frank house - a big highlight for our family and very moving.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Liverpoolmum
Reviews.Content: Receptionist let us check in 2 hours early, room was nice and big, air conitioner worked, windows opened even though we kept them closed. Beds were sooooo comfy, bathroom was lovely and very clean, could have done with a double bed rather than two singles, you get a kettle in the room and powered milk but had to buy our own carton of milk each morning as there's no fridge. You get the 14 tram into dam square or 21 bus. It takes about 15 mins but we didn't mind cos you save loads on hotel price. Apart from checking in and out we only went to reception once and the blonde receptionist wasnt friendly at all, never smiled and practically ignored us, but apart from that we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jahmakean
Reviews.Content: Just vacationed in Amsterdam and spent one night, at the Blue Square, very helpful staff and the rooms were very nice for the price, parking in the rear takes a little time to figure out. Family was very comfortable and only 10 minutes drive to down town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if don't mind location”
Reviews.Author: daveuk101
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very reasonable, room good size even for single, tea/coffee making facilities were also good. Beakfast offered quite wide spread of hot and cold. Reception staff spoke good english. Only downside was location - about 20 mins from centre although both buses and trams (Bus 21 to Central Station, Tram 14 to Dam and Tram 7 to Leidesplein) go to various central locations which are pretty regular, if you don't mind location would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: javp
Reviews.Content: The Blue Square doen't look great from the outside. Yes, it's blue and square, in a turkish residential area. Even so, inside the hotel is surprisingly aggreable, clean and confortable. Outside, you can find a nice small street market and you never feel unsafe by walking around. The rooms are correct and have all you need for a short stay. The breakfast was good and the staff attitude is one of the best values of this hotel. I had a problem with the battery of my car in the hotel garage, and the reception staff were unbelievable in their efforts to solve this. Thank you for that. The BS is a little bit far away from the city centre of Amsterdam, but you have a tram (n. 14) directly to the Dam. By taxi, expect to spend about â‚¬ 20. If do not want (or need) to be in the centre and do not want (or can) too much money on an hotel in Amsterdam - and, remember, hotels in Amsterdam costs you lots of money - then the Blue Sqaure can be a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hosstraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel twice in July. First trip with a friend, 3 nights, second trip alone, 2 nights. Had the chance to see several rooms, some have views to a nice lake area behind the hotel, others have interior window views and you won't open the curtains; some rooms are quite large, and others amazingly small, somewhat 'Dutch' in style. But all the rooms I saw were modern and nicely decorated, good beds, good baths, etc. The TV offerings are rather slim, including the pay-per-view, but the 'included' Wi-Fi" for Internet was certainly a bonus. I found the staff to range from businesslike/pleasant, to extremely helpful, as was the case when I arrived very late one Thursday night to find I had booked my reservation at a different Best Western location. Patrick, the night desk person was truly great in all the ways possible. First, seeing I was quite tired, he offered me refreshment, helped me get to get a room here, and to contact the other location for me. He put a considerable amount of extra effort to a problem that was only my fault, my mistake. This Hotel is a little basic looking from the outside, but inside the rooms are nice. And it isn't anything like being in the center, but I used 3 different bus/train routes to get to and from the hotel, and found the 20 minute or so ride from the center quite pleasant. This location, and the similar Best Western Blue Tower are both excellent values, in part by being a little further from the center but both having plenty of transportation options.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs! - Â¡Chinches!”
Reviews.Author: JohannaGuerrero
Reviews.Content: The first impression of the hotel wasn't bad, only the district seemed quite different as well as the couple of guests, who (I believe) came to Amsterdam seeking for things they can't enjoy in their countries. We had booked 3 nights in this hotel, which looked quite nice on the photos published on Booking.com. The room was nice, just repaired with new furniture and two large windows, only the curtains were dirty and there were a strange smell. The first evening I saw an insect on my bed, but I just threw it out. In the morning the same kind of insect was on the wall, so my husband threw it out as well, but at that moment I thought it could be a bedbug. There was a free internet connection at the hotel, so we connected to Google Images and found that the insects of our room were bedbugs. We found the third one on the wall and took a photo of it (attached). Then we told to the receptionist, who laughed at our complain till we showed her the photo. At once she became serious and offered us another room that we refused since the bedbugs live in plagues. The receptionist was very kind to us and finally found another accommodation for the same rate within the same chain: Best Western Blue Tower Hotel. This hotel was quite nice, located in a better district, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: skusderci
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Amsterdam on business, we needed to find a reasonable hotel for everyone, as some people had a budget. Our PA booked the Blue Square Hotel, when we pulled up infront I turned to my husband and said, "this is horrible"! Thankfully when we checked into our rooms it was the exact opposite! The beds were incredibly comfortable, the shower was very nice and all completed in marble. The wardrobers were nice and large with plenty of space for our clothes with nice hangers. I must admit that for a 3 star hotel I was impressed! Breakfast was included, and was very good. The staff was wonderful, I have a sugar problem and on more than one occassion in the evening when everything was closed they allowed me to get food for a sandwich. Very friendly and helpful staff, so happy we stayed her, as the cost was incredibly cheap and only 15 mins to central Amsterdam on Trams. Would stay there atain!

Reviews.Title: “Out of town; not particularly child friendly”
Reviews.Author: SherlockParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights as part of a lastminute.com package. Hotel is situated in a predominantly Turkish suburb, about 30 mins tram ride from Amsterdam. Virtually nowhere to eat out in the vicinity, even on a Saturday evening! Hotel dinner at 17,50 â‚¬ and breakfast 10â‚¬ with no reduction for children. A very shocking incident: in our room the Pay TV was ON by default, and the kids saw hard-core pornography... before their screams woke up my dozing husband! If you have children, make sure the Pay TV is OFF by default when you check in. The kettle in the room was appreciated; it would've been nice to have a mini fridge too.

Reviews.Title: “Within Easy Reach Of The City”
Reviews.Author: Wrighty91
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10-13 May in a triple room. Overall the rooms were very modern and clean and the staff could not do enough to help. One night once the restaurant had closed they made some sandwiches for us free of charge. The number 14 tram stops right outside the hotel and cost 2.40euros To Dam square. The number 13 tram stops just up the road and goes to Dam square and Centraal Station again at a cost of 2.40. Location wise there is an Aldi and supermarket near by and also a flee market happens most days outside the Aldi. We spent most time out of the hotel but when we were there it made for a very pleasent stay. Best beds in Europe ;)

Reviews.Title: “Blue Square Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: Holly_s_Mum
Reviews.Content: Good 3* hotel with clean and spacious rooms. Staff very welcoming and helpful. Only had breakfast and that was 'ok' but all-in-all a very pleasant stay. 20 mins tram ride from entre of Amsterdam but that's ok bearing in mind to stay in the centre would cost a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Quite disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lidaGreece
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel is situated far away from the town center. But we thought that it would offer more than a hotel in the center with the same price. I felt disappointed as I discovered that the room did not reflect its price at all. I would not recommend this hotel as its quite expensive for its service. The single room has two beds on the opposite site which is really depressing!!!

Reviews.Title: “to far away from town center”
Reviews.Author: boneyemm
Reviews.Content: when we arrived at the blue square hotel i was pleased it looked clean and tidy, but we did arrive at night it was a different story in the day time very dirty looking even the area was untidy. we went to book in the hotel lobby was clean and tidy staff was polite, we when to are room and the room was really nice, you are also by a river and that did smell and in the mornings ur woken to duck and swans the other problem we had with this brake was that it's to far from the town center and it's easy to get lost if ur not sure of the tram system we did get lost and that was scary the tram that goes in to Dam Square is number 14 tram and they are every 10 to 15 min be carefull thow the tram's are expencive u need to buy a pass that can last ur trip and any newsagents do this. i do reconmend that if ur not worryed about going to the town then ur fine but if u want the night life then get closer to the town center it's just to far there is a good resturant/ bar called tottoncarmoon not far from the hotel but that's the only good resturant there but is expencive so enjoy ur trip

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Pip182
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on tour with Contiki. We were very pleasantly surprised by the good accommodation. The room was very nicely and basically furnished. THe bed was THE BEST, had the best nights sleep here in all of Europe. The shower was very nice. Bathroom smallish but did the job. Is out of town a bit, but we used the local bus at night time which seemed pretty easy.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Trip”
Reviews.Author: saffainlondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in late december. It was better than it looked from the outside! When we arrived at the hotel it looks a bit like a hostel with lots of young travellers staying there. The outside looks ok, but made me feel wary about what we would we get inside. I was quiet surprised, the rooms were large clean and the beds were big! The rooms was a bit sparse, but I wasn't there for the room! The bathroom was a bit small but the shower was big and had a huge shower head and plently hot water! Breakfast was ok, it was continental with enough choice to keep even the most fussy person happy. The staff were always helpful and willin to be of service. We did have a few issues with the safe not locking and then not unlockin the next day but this was soon sorted out. The hotel is not in the centre of Amsterdam and you will need to take a short bus or tram trip to the centre. Which can be a bit of pain if its cold and yu just want to get to bed after a long day walking around. This hotel is perfect for those looking to keep their budget down but still stay somewhere nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, but Amsterdam? Not for me”
Reviews.Author: VicM
Reviews.Content: This was an OK hotel, we are a family of 4, the hotel room was clean and reasonably large, but it was bare - a table with some chairs would have been great. The bathroom was reasonable. The hotel was quite a distance out of the city and you had to catch a bus to get in and out. If you are travelling with your family, the location of the hotel is an advantage. After you have been walking around the city all day smelling the hash, it is very pleasent to go somewhere where the air is fresh. Amsterdam is the sort of city you visit once and never visit again, it has very little to offer - you may think that all the best artists came from there and you can visit galleries and see this great art, unfortunately none of it is there. Hotel was OK, city was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sarahusarmywife
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to find. Hotel reception clean and bright. Room furniture all new. Room clean. Near public transportation. Inexpensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carla045
Reviews.Content: stayed here while on our tour. Hotel was under renovations at the time. Our room furnishings were all brand new, clean and just great! Cna't complain. Easy to get to city also, tram passes right out the front.

Reviews.Title: “New but allready worn.”
Reviews.Author: Kvarnby
Reviews.Content: As this is a brand new hotell We expected it to be realy fresch but even if it did not seem ready in many ways (signs whith directions on A4 sheets standing on the floor, no information about anything in the room etc.) it already seemed very old and worn (elevators had holes covered by tape, furniture is missing handles and knobbs etc.). We had room 235 at the second floor facing the side of the hotell, the size was good and it was clean and pretty noicefree but the missing parts on the furniture gave a cheep impession. The room had a bath and if You like to shower make sure to get a room thithout the bath as it does not have a handheld shower. Taking a shower i also noticed the electrical work i the bathroom not very proffesional looking to say the least (look at pictures) and it sure wasn't cleaned up there since the work was done. Another odd electrical soulution was the light. The light by the waterheater and the bedlight was conected so You have to keep one lamp in the room lit if You want to use the bedlights and leave the bed to turn it off. STUPID! The bed by the way was good put the pillows were terrible! Big, high and hard like rock, coud not sleep more than half an hour on it whithout waking up whith a neckpain :-( The front desk staf was very helpfull and nice and the distance to the city centre is no big problem as the tram is just outside the hotell. Just next to the hotell where's a weekend market, shopps, cafÃ©s and some restaurants. Breakfast was okej but not more, a toaster for the bread could be nice and more variety would not hurt. Overall the hotell is enough for a few days but not as good as expected by a brand new place.

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: Ryddid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 20 min tram ride out of town and convenient to get to. There are also various bus routes, etc. but you will need to email the hotel for these. The front of the hotel can get noisy when tourist buses are there (trundling cases, engines, etc.). I was moved to a room at the back (ground floor windows do not open) which had a lovely view of a skip full of dirty rubbish bags. The furniture is dark and retro. The padded chairs seem to have been recycled from another hotel and are scruffy. The building seems like a recycled office block. There are no door numbers â€“ just handwritten ones on sticky tape. There are gloss paint streaks every so often on the carpets. The rooms are clean and bearable but there are no instructions r.e. the phones, etc. All phones are blocked because of tour groups, so check at reception if you are a solo traveller. Plumbing can be very noisy. Overall, it is bearable. The worst thing about this place is the breakfast. There is a limited selection of badly prepared food (stale muesli, cheese hard at the edges, bacon in a puddle, etc). The coffee machine blocks every so often. There seems to be no dining hall manager. There is no trolley to clear the tables so that each table cleared means a separate trip from the kitchen. For people who want to fix their own packed lunch the lack of supervision is a gift. We watched one family of 4 adults make a loaf of sandwiches plus umpteen packets of jam, biscuits and liver pate and they werenâ€™t the only ones. I was very surprised to find that this hotel was a Best Western. Good reception staff but overall badly run, lack of attention to detail and un co-ordinated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would def. recommend”
Reviews.Author: anika_35
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel as a stop-over on our Contiki tour. The hotel does look a bit dodgy on the outside but looks really are deceiving!! The hotel is beautifully new and spotlessly clean. The rooms were all very modern with enough space to put your baggage down- which is something to say for hotels in Europe. The location isn't exactly ideal, but it isn't too far away from the center.

Reviews.Title: “True Blue (how cheesy)”
Reviews.Author: Benfromsydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night, as noted in the earlier reviews, the hotel is fairly ugly from the outside but once inside it is a really nice 3 star hotel. There were a few works still going on but they were no problem and did not affect us. The rooms are furnished with what seems quite expensive furniture though not really my taste. It was almost like antique furniture. Staff were nice and the girl who checked us in spoke 4 different languages to different guests all very fluently. I would def recommend BSH it was a bit of a trek out of the city but easy enough. Take the 13 or 14 from centraal sit back and relax. Its not that far.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Square Still Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: qenzen1
Reviews.Content: All in all I was very pleased with the value received from the Blue Square Hotel. The building really could use a coat of paint outside. It looks pretty bad at the moment. The inside and the rooms are completed but there are some issues to be worked out. I had a dead desk lamp, the phone could not dial an outside line (fixed during stay) and the free wireless internet was not working. The room itself looked great, so did the bathroom and the view from room 288 was fantastic. I had a powerful hot shower, flat screen tv and a new bed. The hotel offers a free breakfast which I enjoyed. Hot foods were scrambled eggs, bacon, mushrooms and tomatoes. Fresh bread, cheese, deli meats, yogurt, fruit, orange juice and an espresso machine for coffee were also available. Tram 14 and 7 stop about a half block from the front door for easy access to downtown about a 25 minute ride each way. You can use tram stop Plein 40-45 to access the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice blue”
Reviews.Author: daniu
Reviews.Content: Well, getting to Blue Square Hotel from Central Station was quite a task considering it was my first time in Amsterdam. But the good tram network in the city ensured that I got to the hotel in Slotermeer within 30 minutes from the city centre. Was pleasantly surprised when they upgraded me to a double room. The hotel is very new and the room is nice and neat, with a LCD screen tv mounted on the wall. Room size was relatively big for city standards. There's free Wifi which worked perfectly, while the tv showed quite a number of european channels, including BBC! The hotel is about 20 to 30 minutes to the city by tram...tram stop is right outside the hotel. Trams 7, 13 and 14 all connects the hotel to the city. There's a neighbourhood mall just 2 minutes walk from the hotel. They have quite good stuffs there, including supermarkets, clothing stores, pharmacy, cafes etc. There's even a flea market right outside the mall on weekends. Interesting to see what Dutch people sell in their local markets. All in all, a value for money hotel, far away from the crowd of the city. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Scary blue building”
Reviews.Author: conscienceBrussels
Reviews.Content: The first impression of the Blue Square Hotel is: what a horrible blue building. But do not let you scare off by the outside. This brand new building is nice and airy. The rooms are spacious and clean, the breakfast was good and the staff was really very friendly. This hotel gives you definitely value for money

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Blue Square Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Slotermeerlaan 80, Amsterdam 1064 HD, The Netherlands
